u-oOHQhjBzuWKDJLa.author: RL <iFIjgKg2M7TIe5ygfjFzaDEAlAX2>
u-oOHQhjBzuWKDJLa.info:
To import your transactions from Interactive Brokers:

1. Go to [IBKR](https://www.interactivebrokers.co.uk/)
2. Open **Performance & Reports** ‚Üí **Flex Queries** ‚Üí **Activity Flex Query** 
3. Create new Flex Query with a **+** sign
4. From **Sections** choose the: 
**- Cash Transactions**
**- Trades**
**- Transfers**
5. Set Format to **CSV**
6. Set Date Format to **yyyy-MM-dd**
7. Set Time Format to **HH:mm:ss**
8. Save the query
9. Run created query with the arrow sign (**‚Üí**)
10. Choose date period (maximum is one year, you will need an export per each year), ensure Format is **CSV** format and save the file somewhere
11. Open or drop that file here

> ü¶â If your IBKR account was recently migrated from HU to IE, first import transactions from the HU account, and then continue with the new one. You can select your account near the `Flex Queries` title.

stmts.md: First, we need to ignore transactions that were cancelled

note.value: üí∞ Cash transactions are currently not imported

note.formula: ="ü•∫ Asset class `" + col("AssetClass") + "` is currently not supported"

note.value: ‚òùÔ∏è ADRs are imported as their underlying stock

stmts.md:
Dividends can be spread out through multiple rows with the same `ActionID`.
We collect all these rows and create a single transaction.

note.value:
üî≠ This file contains Withholding tax updates for dividends that are not in it. You need to export both the dividend and the tax transactions in a *single file*.

If the dividend is already imported, it will be marked as a duplicate - once you combine the files, locate these dividends and change their status from `Duplicate` to `Update`

stmts.md:
## Broker fees

Broker fees can be positive (ü§Ø) - when IBKR is paying us, or negative, when it's a regular fee

note.value: üí∏ Cash deposits and withdrawals are currently not imported

note.formula: ="ü•∫ Cash transactions of type `" + col("Type") + "` are currently not supported"

note.value:
‚òùÔ∏è An internal stock transfer has been found. If your IBKR account was recently moved (ie. from Hungary to Ireland), this is probably it.

If you already imported the history of the previous account - remove these transactions by ignoring them in the table.
